      <title><![CDATA[MapMyIndia Q1 Results | Net profit surges 29% to ₹46 crore; revenue up 20%]]></title>
      <link><![CDATA[https://www.cnbctv18.com/market/stocks/mapmyindia-ce-info-systems-share-price-q1-results-net-profit-surges-29-to-rs-46-crore-revenue-up-20-19650630.htm]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[The company's revenue from operations increased 19.9% to ₹121.6 crore as against ₹101.4 crore in the corresponding period of the preceding fiscal. Shares of CE Info Systems Ltd ended at ₹1,760.50, up by ₹9.65 or 0.55% on the BSE.]]></description>
      <pubDate><![CDATA[Thu, 7 Aug 2025 22:49:57 +0530]]></pubDate>

      <guid><![CDATA[https://www.cnbctv18.com/market/stocks/mapmyindia-ce-info-systems-share-price-q1-results-net-profit-surges-29-to-rs-46-crore-revenue-up-20-19650630.htm]]></guid>
      <category><![CDATA[Business]]></category>
      <media:content height="675" width="1200" medium="image" url="https://images.cnbctv18.com/uploads/2025/05/prostarm-info-systems-ipo-2025-05-1ddb13e4fe4138eb1b6dbf3f7f3aa03a.jpg"/>
    </item>
    <item>
      <title><![CDATA[Biocon Q1 Results | Net profit tanks 95% to ₹31 crore, misses estimates]]></title>
      <link><![CDATA[https://www.cnbctv18.com/market/stocks/biocon-share-price-q1-results-net-profit-tanks-95-to-rs-31-crore-misses-estimates-ws-l-19650624.htm]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[Revenue from operations, however, grew 1 4.8% YoY to ₹3,942 crore, against ₹3,433 crore in the year-ago period. This figure too fell short of the CNBC-TV18 poll, which had pegged revenue at ₹4,096.2 crore.]]></description>
      <pubDate><![CDATA[Thu, 7 Aug 2025 22:54:50 +0530]]></pubDate>
      <dc:creator>Megha Rani</dc:creator>

      <link><![CDATA[https://www.cnbctv18.com/market/stocks/tata-group-loses-120-billion-in-market-value-amid-tariffs-it-slowdown-19649176.htm]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[The group’s crown jewel, Tata Consultancy Services (TCS), has been the biggest casualty, losing nearly $70 billion in market value since September last year. Tata Motors is the second-largest contributor to the group’s market cap erosion, with a decline of around $21 billion. Together, these two companies account for nearly 75% of the total erosion in market value over the past year.]]></description>
